goals.question: What is the distribution of BMI among the population?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the spread of BMI values among the population and identify any potential outliers.

goals.question: Is there a correlation between BMI and physical activity?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of BMI vs Physical Activity
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify any correlation between BMI and physical activity levels, which can help us understand the impact of physical activity on BMI.

goals.question: What is the distribution of obesity levels among different age groups?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of obesity levels by age group
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the prevalence of obesity among different age groups and identify any trends or patterns.

goals.question: What is the distribution of obesity levels among different countries?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of obesity levels by country
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the prevalence of obesity among different countries and identify any potential factors that may contribute to higher obesity rates in certain countries.

goals.question: What is the relationship between BMI and diabetes?
goals.visualization: Box plot of BMI by diabetes status
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the relationship between BMI and diabetes, and identify any potential differences in BMI between individuals with and without diabetes.

code:
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    sns.histplot(data=data, x='BMI', kde=True, color='blue')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of BMI among the population?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data = data.dropna(subset=['BMI', 'PhysicalActivity'])
    sns.scatterplot(x='BMI', y='PhysicalActivity', data=data)
    plt.title('Is there a correlation between BMI and physical activity?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data = data.dropna(subset=['age_group', 'obesity_level'])
    chart = sns.catplot(x='age_group', y='obesity_level', data=data, kind='bar', palette='muted')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of obesity levels among different age groups?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    sns.set(style="whitegrid")
    chart = sns.barplot(x="Country", y="Obesity", data=data)
    chart.set_xticklabels(chart.get_xticklabels(), rotation=90)
    plt.title("What is the distribution of obesity levels among different countries?", wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['diabetes'] = data['diabetes'].replace({0: 'No', 1: 'Yes'})
    sns.boxplot(x='diabetes', y='bmi', data=data)
    plt.title('What is the relationship between BMI and diabetes?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
